page.title: 17TRAFFIC SURVEY
page.content: The traffic survey took place on the A57 outside our school at Crosspool in the summer of 1985 during both the rush hours and the quiet hours of the day. In the main rush hour between 0800hrs. and 0900 hrs. four times as many cars were travelling into town than out. In the off-peak hours the traffic travelling in and out of town was approximately the same. Buses came every fifteen minutes. Two thirds of our class voted that the pavements on Manchester Road should be wider. Many parents think that there should be a Pelican crossing here instead of the crossing lady that we now have. Mr Stocks, our old traffic warden, died after a car hit him while he was showing a child across the road in December 1984.
